timeline.message:
Revert "Update trustyCI.yml"

This reverts commit e28aaa2c0876b61441bec40203b1ca39d066630d.

timeline.bodyText: Why these changes? Most (all?) of the codebase use import static
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: I think storage.api.annotations is misleading for this. Can you please move it to storage.factory?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: I think storage.api.annotations is misleading for this. Can you please move it to storage.factory?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: I think storage.api.annotations is misleading for this. Can you please move it to storage.factory?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Can you rename it as Storage?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Can you rename it as StorageService?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: We are not using IName naming convention for interfaces in this project so please rename it as DataIndexStorageService
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText:
Can you please rename it as DataIndexStorageServiceImpl?
Missing @ApplicationScoped annotation
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Is this custom? Can we move it to shared library too?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Is this custom? Can we move it to shared library too?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
@danielezonca This class is process specific: it uses the cache getProcessIdModelCache i.e. PROCESS_ID_MODEL_CACHE. In addition to that it is infinispan specific since it uses ProtobufMetadataManagerConstants.ERRORS_KEY_SUFFIX .
We might create an abstract class in the common module but most of the implementation would remain in the consumer code. wdyt?
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Ok let's postpone this changes to a future ticket. Can you please open a ticket for that?
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: Yes, done
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText:
Is it possible to move most of this data-index-storage-protobuf module as additional shared module?
We can try to use the same approach of shared base module and then data-index specific additions
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: The protobuf module is strongly coupled with processes and infinispan, if we want to move it to a common module it requires more work. Let's do that in another PR
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: I've moved it : )
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText:
I think we can make this generic too adding String storageType as parameter and rename the method as getModelCacheByType(storageType).
In this way PROCESS_ID_MODEL_CACHE can be moved out of this class and provided as parameter.
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Please move the whole graphql package to common module
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: as agreeded by phone call we postpone this to another ticket
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Can you please create a ticket to track it?
replies.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Can you please rename this class as StorageQualifier?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Can you please rename this class as StorageQualifierImpl?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Please rename the method as getModelCacheByType
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Please rename parameters as type and elementId
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Remove TODO?
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: I think getProtobufCache should be part of the protobuf implementation, because other types of storage service won't be able to implement the interface.
timeline.author: xieshenzh

replies.bodyText:
Hi @xiezhang7 , thx for the comment!
Do you mean that getProtobufCache should be implemented only by the infinispan module and the ProtobufService should then depend directly on the infinispan module only?
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Yes. Thanks.
replies.author: xieshenzh

replies.bodyText: I've moved getProtobufCache to the ProtobufService with the commit 2c6a4ec. The ProtobufService is now injected in the DataIndexStorageServiceImpl -> the interface for the data-index is not changed. Let me know wdyt @xiezhang7
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: I don't think ProtobufService should be injected in the DataIndexStorageServiceImpl. Because only ProtoSchemaManager invokes getProtobufCache which is part of the infinispan implementation. Other storage implementations won't need this service. So it could be injected in ProtoSchemaManager directly.
replies.author: xieshenzh

replies.bodyText: Ok, I've removed getProtobufCache from DataIndexStorageServiceImpl and I've injected directly the ProtobufService where needed to provide the protobuf cache, lmkwyt
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText: Map is not used by the interface and can be removed.
timeline.author: xieshenzh

replies.bodyText: Removed
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText: I don't think AttributeDescriptor, DomainDescriptor and DomainModelRegisteredEvent should be part of the protobuf implementation. They are supposed to be part of the API. If the data structure is not ideal, maybe we can review it in future.
timeline.author: xieshenzh

replies.bodyText: Moved to api.proto, if it's fine for you feel free to resolve the conversation
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.message: move protobuf domain to api and remove unused imports
remove getProtobufCache from DataIndexStorageManager, ProtobufService injected directly in protobuf manager

timeline.bodyText: can we keep the import * ? :)
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText: @r00ta perhaps move this file to StorageImpl so we can keep its change history?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: @cristianonicolai do you have any tip to do the trick? I tried for some time but I did not find the way to make it work (the last thing I'd like to do is to create a new PR and copy/paste the new code there :) ).
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: yeah git doesnt like if you move and do significant changes to a file in the same commit :/ the usual workaround is to break move and changes into different prs but not sure how feasible that is in here.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText:
btw I see your point, unfortunately moving a lot files I missed that intellij deleted/created this new file.
Actually the history of this file was just one commit before this PR, but I understand that we should keep it. Once we are ok with this PR I'll create a new fresh branch/PR with the code (and properly rename the file :) ) if it's ok for you
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: sure, np
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText:
Hi @cristianonicolai , I've moved everything to another PR. The funny thing is that In the commits none of the files were deleted, but github still think that a couple of them are deleted/recreated. Investigating a little bit I found out that also in the current PR git blame works perfectly, so the history is there also for the files StorageImpl/CacheImpl.

But unfortunately ProtoDomainModelProducerTest does not have it.
We can move to the PR #266 where Github thinks that only a couple of files are re-created (but git blame works perfectly on them), or stay in this one where ProtoDomainModelProducerTest has no history.
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText: should this file be moved instead?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Same as above
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText: It feels that getDomainModelCache and getModelCacheByType are specific to data index I would leave that in the data index storage.
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

timeline.message: Provide the parametrized type in AttributeFilter

timeline.bodyText: Is there any reason behind changing access modifier from public to default? same goes to the test methods below. This is not consistent with all the test classes in this module (all are public).
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: It was a sonarcloud warning (it's present in all the builds actually, see here https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=org.kie.kogito%3Akogito-apps&open=AXI4nFUhwTXxARAeQrZ2&pullRequest=231&resolved=false) . I can change it back, I don't have a strong opinion on that. lmkwyt
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: I would rather keep it with public access but just because all the rest of the test classes in this module are defined as public, just to keep it consistent in this particular case.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText: why changing access modifier to default? is there any reason behind? same goes to the test methods. All the test classes are defined as public with public test methods. Just to keep it consistent across modules.
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Same as above, let me know : )
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: it is ok here, there are no other test classes. Thanks!
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Ok! I'll leave it as it is now then
replies.author: r00ta
